mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Don Diego Navarro, 1780 April 30
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:contributor: Navarro García de Valladares, Diego José, 1708-1784
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Written at Washington's headquarters in Morristown. Reports death of Don Juan Mirailles [Spanish envoy] who came on visit with Minister of France and was seized on arrival with "a violent biliary complaint" -- died despite best care of physicians and himself -- present his respects to [Mirailles's] lady. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, watermark (J. Taylor, & an encircled armed figure). Navarro was Governor & Capt. General of Cuba.
